text:
From 7th Heaven

"And Away We Go" was the twenty-second and final episode of the 7th Heaven series, bringing its 11th season to a close. It was also the second series finale that the show had aired, the previous one being the 2006 episode And Thank You. On its original airing, the episode scored a 3.32 million viewers.

edit] Plot

Warning: Significant plot details follow.

After 11 heavenly seasons in Glenoak, the longest-running family drama in television history bids us farewell as Eric and Annie decide to pack up and travel America in their new RV.



Eric and Annie decide to pack it all up and see America by way of an RV, given to them in celebration of Eric's clean bill of health. Initially taken aback by this momentous and sudden decision, Lucy and Kevin ultimately decide to join Eric, Annie and the rest of the family - and extended family - on their exciting new adventure.



Meanwhile, Ruthie announces that she has unexpectedly received enough credits to graduate high school, thanks to the courses she took last summer and last fall in Scotland; she also turns down Martin's offers of a relationship for the final time; it is announced that Simon is graduating college and the family will make that one of their first stops in the RV; according to Ruthie, Simon also seems to be serious with a new woman and possibly thinking about marriage; Margaret was accepted into college; Jane stated that she got a call from her mother, who recently entered Narcotics Anonymous; Mac admits that he is in love with Margaret; and T-Bone and Ruthie have decided to stay together and possibly travel together next year.

edit] Notes

This was the second series finale the series had aired, the first being the final episode of season 10, And Thank You, which aired just four days before the CW unexpectedly renewed the show for an 11th season.

Only season without Simon (David Gallagher), or Matt (Barry Watson) in any episode, and the 2nd season without Mary (Jessica Biel) in any episode.

edit] Opening Credits

Featured in the opening credits are:



Stephen Collins (clips from seasons 1, 5, 11)

Catherine Hicks (clips from seasons 1, 5, 11)

Beverley Mitchell (clips from seasons 1, 3, 11)

Mackenzie Rosman (clips from seasons 1, 7, 11)

Nikolas/Lorenzo Brino (clips from seasons 5, 7, 11)

George Stults (clips from seasons 7, 8, 11)

Tyler Hoechlin (clips from seasons 8, 10, 11)

Haylie Duff (3 new clips from season 11)





edit] Allusions

Eric, upon finding an old atlas in the cabinet: 1996, that is a little dusty. --> 7th Heaven premiered in 1996.

edit] Music

I'll Fly Away
